Module IO
Package buffer

Class DynamicByteBuffer

java.lang.Object
buffer.DynamicByteBuffer
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable, Cloneable
public class DynamicByteBuffer extends Object implements AutoCloseable, Cloneable
A dynamic byte array that provides methods to store and retrieve various data types with a growing internal array.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DynamicByteBuffer()
    Constructs a DynamicByteArray with an initial capacity of 128 bytes.
    DynamicByteBuffer(byte[] data)
    Constructs a DynamicByteArray with the specified data byte array.
    DynamicByteBuffer(int initialCapacity)
    Constructs a DynamicByteArray with the specified initial capacity.
    DynamicByteBuffer(int initialCapacity, boolean growing)
    Constructs a DynamicByteArray with the specified initial capacity.

    • DynamicByteBuffer

      public DynamicByteBuffer()
      Constructs a DynamicByteArray with an initial capacity of 128 bytes.

    • DynamicByteBuffer

      public DynamicByteBuffer(int initialCapacity)
      Constructs a DynamicByteArray with the specified initial capacity.
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - The initial capacity of the byte array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if initial capacity is non-positive.

    • DynamicByteBuffer

      public DynamicByteBuffer(int initialCapacity, boolean growing)
      Constructs a DynamicByteArray with the specified initial capacity.
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - The initial capacity of the byte array.
      growing - The flag to determine if the internal byte array should grow when reaching its limit.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if initial capacity is non-positive.

    • DynamicByteBuffer

      public DynamicByteBuffer(byte[] data)
      Constructs a DynamicByteArray with the specified data byte array.
      Parameters:
      data - The byte array to fill as the internal array.

  • Method Details

    • writeBits

      public void writeBits(int value, int numBits)
      Writes a specified number of bits from the given integer value to the dynamic byte buffer. Bits are written from the least significant bit (LSB) to the most significant bit (MSB).
      Parameters:
      value - The integer value from which to extract bits.
      numBits - The number of bits to write. Must be between 1 and 32, inclusive.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of bits is not within the valid range.

    • readBits

      public int readBits(int numBits)
      Reads a specified number of bits from the dynamic byte buffer and returns them as an integer. Bits are read from the least significant bit (LSB) to the most significant bit (MSB).
      Parameters:
      numBits - The number of bits to read. Must be between 1 and 32, inclusive.
      Returns:
      The integer value represented by the read bits.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of bits is not within the valid range.

    • writeString

      public void writeString(String string)
      Stores a string value in the dynamic byte array at the current write position.
      Parameters:
      string - The string to store.

    • readString

      public String readString()
      Retrieves a String value from the dynamic byte array at the current read position and increments the read position.
      Returns:
      The string at the current read position.

    • writeByte

      public void writeByte(int value)

    • close

      public void close() throws Exception
      Closes this resource, releasing any associated resources or performing cleanup actions.

      This method is called when the resource is no longer needed and should be used to perform any necessary cleanup operations, such as releasing file handles, network connections, or freeing up resources. Subclasses should override this method to implement their own cleanup logic.

      If an exception is thrown during the cleanup process, it should be caught and properly handled to ensure that the resource is still closed correctly. Any exception thrown by this method will be propagated up and should be handled by the caller.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while closing the resource

    • clone

      public DynamicByteBuffer clone()
      Creates a deep clone of the current DynamicByteBuffer instance, including its byte data and configuration settings.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      A new DynamicByteBuffer instance that is a deep clone of the current instance.
